sentences.sentence: The Wolves( 狼 ) and the Sheep
“Why are there always wars between us?” said the wolves( 狼 ) to the sheep.
“Those evil( 邪恶的 ) dogs are the problem.
They always bark( 吠叫 ) when we get near you, and attack us before we have done anything.
If you would get rid of( 赶走 ) them, there would be peace between us.”
The silly sheep were easily cheated( 被欺骗 ), and got rid of( 赶走 ) the dogs.
The wolves( 狼 ) then had no problem eating all the sheep.
MORAL: Don’t change friends for enemies.
The Woman and Her Bucket( 桶 ) of Milk
A farmer’s daughter was carrying her bucket( 桶 ) of milk from the field to the farmhouse( 农舍 ), when she thought to herself,
“The money I get for this milk will buy at least three hundred eggs.
The eggs will produce at least two hundred and fifty chickens.
The chickens will become ready for the market when chickens sell for the highest price.
By the end of the year, I will have enough money to buy a new dress.
In this dress, I will go to the best parties.
All the young men will ask to marry me, but I will shake my head and refuse them all.”
At this moment, she shook her head, as if saying No to the young men.
Unfortunately( 不幸地 ), she dropped the bucket( 桶 ) of milk to the ground, and all her dreams were lost in a moment.
MORAL: Don’t lose your present in dreams of your future.
Zeus and Man
They say that at the very beginning, when the animals were created for the first time, each of them received gifts from Zeus, the king of the gods.
To some he gave strength, to some he gave speed, and to others, he gave wings to fly high in the sky.
But man saw himself naked( 赤裸的 ) and said to Zeus, “Why have you given no gift to me?”
Zeus replied, “You do not see the gift you have been given, which is the greatest of all.
You have received the gift of language and the ability to reason.
If you use this gift well, you can use it to become stronger than the strongest and faster than the fastest animal on earth.”
Then man realized the gift he had been given and bowed down to( 鞠躬 ) Zeus to thank him.
MORAL: Speech and reason are our most precious( 珍贵的 ) gifts.
Zeus and the Monkey
Zeus let it be known among all the animals that he was offering a prize for the animal that had the most beautiful baby.
The monkey came with the rest and showed to Zeus, with all a mother’s tenderness( 温柔 ), a flat-nosed, hairless, ugly baby monkey as a candidate( 候选人 ) for the promised reward( 奖赏 ).
All the gods laughed at( 嘲笑 ) her ugly baby, but she said,
“I do not know whether Zeus will give the prize to my son, but this I do know—
that at least in my eyes, he is the dearest, handsomest, and most beautiful of all.”
MORAL: Seen through the eyes of love, everyone is beautiful.

article_info.previous: 在昨天的故事里，狼宁愿吃不好也不想被圈养。这个故事告诉我们当失去自由的时候，面对再好的食物也会失去胃口。
article_info.share_words: Don’t lose your present in dreams of your future.    Seen through the eyes of love, everyone is beautiful.

question.cn: 在故事The Wolves and the Sheep中，羊赶走狗之后发生了什么？
question.en: In the story the Wolves and the Sheep, what happened after the sheep got rid of the dogs?

options.en: The sheep was eaten by the wolves.
The sheep made friends with the wolves.
The sheep was killed by the dogs.

analysis: 文中提到：“The silly sheep were easily cheated, and got rid of the dogs. The wolves then had no problem eating all the sheep.”可知，当羊把狗赶走后，狼吃了所有的羊，因此选A。

question.cn: 在故事The Woman and Her Buckets of Milk中，女儿从牧场向农舍运送什么东西？
question.en: In the story the Woman and Her Buckets of Milk, what did the daughter carry from the field to the farmhouse?

analysis: 文中提到：“A farmer's daughter was carrying her bucket of milk from the field to the farmhouse.”农夫的女儿手里提的是牛奶，因此选A。

question.cn: 在故事Zeus and Man中，谁是众神之王？
question.en: In the story Zeus and Man, who was the king of the gods?

analysis: 文中提到：“Each of them received gifts from Zeus, the king of the gods.”可知，Zeus是众神之王，因此选A。

question.cn: 在故事Zeus and Man中，人类得到的天赋是什么？
question.en: In the story Zeus and Man, what gift did man receive?

options.en: Language and the ability to reason.

analysis: 文中提到：“You received the gift of language and the ability to reason.”人类得到的天赋是语言和思考能力，因此选C。

question.cn: 在故事Zeus and the Monkey中，宙斯将会给谁奖励？
question.en: In the story Zeus and the Monkey, which kind of animal would Zeus offer a prize for?

options.cn: 生出最漂亮宝宝的动物。
options.en: The animal who had the most beautiful baby.

options.cn: 生出最强壮宝宝的动物。
options.en: The animal who had the strongest baby.
The animal who had the biggest baby.

analysis: 文中提到：“Zeus let it be known among all the animals that he was offering a prize for the animal that had the most beautiful baby.”可知，宙斯就给生出最漂亮宝宝的动物奖励，因此选A。

question.cn: 在第一天的故事Aesop and Wrestler中，为什么伊索认为胜利者不值得太多的赞扬？
question.en: In the story Aesop and Wrestler during day 1, why didn’t Aesop think that the winner deserved much praise?

options.en: The winner cheated in the competition.

options.cn: 胜利者在比赛中愚弄失败者。
options.en: The winner fooled the loser in the competition.

options.cn: 胜利者本身就比对手更强壮。
options.en: The winner was naturally stronger than his opponent.

analysis: 文中提到：“‘In that case, I don't think you deserve much praise at all,’said Aesop. ‘it is easy to win when you are bigger are bigger and stronger.’”因此选C。

question.cn: 在第二天的故事The Ants and the Grasshopper中，蚂蚱为什么没有在夏天储存食物？
question.en: During day 2  in the story the Ants and the Grasshopper, why didn't the grasshopper collect any food during the summer?

options.cn: 他不能找到足够的食物。
他太懒了，不想储存食物。
options.en: He was too lazy to store any food.

analysis: 文中提到蚂蚱和蚂蚁的对话：“I didn't have any spare time, I spent the days singing.”可以看出，蚂蚱在夏天的时候把时间用来唱歌，所以没有储存冬天的食物，因此选B。

question.cn: 在第三天的故事The Blind Man and the Baby Wolf中，谁可以通过触摸分辨动物？
question.en: In the story the Blind Man and the Baby Wolf during day 3, who could tell different animals by touching them?

analysis: 文中提：“A blind man could tell different animals by touching them with his hands.”因此选A。

question.cn: 在第四天的故事The Boy and The Wolf中，下述哪位杀死了男孩的羊？
question.en: In the story the Boy and The Wolf during Day 4, which of the following killed the boy’s sheep?

analysis: 文中提到：“The wolf is killing the sheep.”可知男孩的羊最后被狼杀掉了，因此选C。

question.cn: 在第五天的故事The Crab and Its Mother 中，螃蟹的妈妈能否向前走？
question.en: In the story the Crab and Its Mother during day 5, could the crab mother walk straight forward？

analysis: 文中提到：“The mother tried to walk straight, but couldn't do it.”可知，螃蟹妈妈也不能向前走，因此选B。

question.cn: 在第六天的故事The Dog, the Rooster, and the Fox中，狐狸为什么想要和公鸡作朋友？
question.en: In the story the Dog, the Rooster, and the Fox during day 6, why did the fox want to make friends with the rooster？

options.en: The fox wanted to eat the rooster.
The fox liked to make friends.
The fox liked the voice of the rooster.

analysis: 文中提到：“A fox heard this, and wishing to make breakfast of him, came and stood under the tree.”狐狸想把公鸡作为自己的早餐，因此选A。

question.cn: 在第八天的故事The Farmer and His Sons中，为什么农场的收成极好？
question.en: In the story the Farmer and His Sons during day 8, why did the farm produce a magnificent crop?

options.en: Because it rained a lot that year.

options.cn: 因为农夫的儿子努力松土。
options.en: Because the sons did much digging.

analysis: 文中提到：“They found no treasure, but the farm, after so much digging, produced a magnificent crop.”由于土地经过大量挖掘松土，所以收获很好，因此选B。

question.cn: 在第九天的故事The Farmer and the Donkey中，为什么驴不害怕士兵？
question.en: In the story the Farmer and the Donkey during Day 9, why wasn't the donkey afraid of the soldiers?

options.cn: 因为他觉得自己即使被抓住了，生活也不会变得更差。
options.en: Because life would not become worse even if the donkey was caught by the soldiers.

options.cn: 因为他觉得士兵不会抓住他。
options.en: Because the donkey thought the soldiers would not take him.
Because the donkey did not want to live any longer.

analysis: 文中提到：“I don't mind if they do take me , for I shan't be any worse off.”驴认为即使被士兵抓走了，以后的生活也不会有有现在差，因此选A。

question.cn: 在第十一天的故事the fox and the crow中，为什么狐狸会赞扬乌鸦？
question.en: In the story of the Fox and the Crow during Day 11, why did the fox praise the crow?

options.en: The fox wanted to eat the crow.
The fox fell in love with the crow.

options.cn: 狐狸想要乌鸦嘴中的肉。
options.en: The fox wanted the meat in the crow's mouth.

analysis: 文中提到：“A fox, seeing her, wanted the meat,”然后狐狸设计陷阱让乌鸦张口，最后“ She started to sing and dropped the meat. The fox quickly picked it up.” 因此选C。

question.cn: 在第十二天的故事The Fox Without a Tail中，狐狸是怎样失去尾巴的？
question.en: In the story the Fox Without a Tail during day 12, how did the fox lose his tail?

options.en: His tail was bitten by a dog.
He was caught in a trap.
He cut off his tail by himself.

analysis: 文中提到：“It happened that a fox was caught in a trap, and lost his tail.”可知狐狸是掉进陷阱里，失去了自己的尾巴，因此选B。

question.cn: 在第十四天的故事Hermes and the Sculptor中，Hermes为什么会询问自己雕像的价格？
question.en: In the story Hermes and the Sculptor during Day 14, why did Hermes ask the price of his own statue?

options.cn: 他想知道人们究竟如何看待他。
options.en: He wanted to know what people on earth thought of him.

analysis: 文中提到：“Hermes was very anxious to know what people on earth thought of him. He disguised himself as a man and walked into a sculptor's studio.”因此选C。

question.cn: 在第十五天的故事Hermes and the Workman中，Hermes为什么把金斧子和银斧子都给了工人？
question.en: In the story Hermes and the Workmen during Day 15, why did Hermes give the first workman the golden and silver axes?

analysis: 文中提到：“Hermes， pleased with his honesty, also gave him the golden and silver axe.”可知Hermes认为这个人很诚实，所以把金斧子和银斧子都送给了他，因此选A。

question.cn: 在第十七天的故事The Lion and the Three Bulls中，一开始狮子为什么不能杀死公牛？
question.en: In the story the Lion and the Three Bulls during Day 17, why couldn't the lion kill the bulls at first?

options.en: Because the bulls were too strong.

analysis: 文中提到：“It was too dangerous so long as they kept together.”公牛们在一起很团结，对狮子来说很危险，因此选C。

question.cn: 在第二十天的故事The Mice and the Cat中，老鼠计划的问题是什么？
question.en: In the story the Mice and the Cat during Day 20, what was the problem with the mouse’s plan?

options.en: “Where was a good place to buy a good bell? ”

analysis: 文中提到：“ I agree that the plan is a good one, but may I ask who is going to put the bell on the cat.”可知，老鼠们计划的问题在于谁来实施，因此选A。

question.cn: 在第二十三天的故事The Old Woman and Her Servants中，公鸡死后发生了什么？
question.en: In the story the Old Woman and Her Servants during Day 23, what happened after the rooster’s death?

options.cn: 仆人们可以睡到自然醒。
options.en: The servants could sleep as long as they want.

options.cn: 仆人们经常在半夜被叫醒。
options.en: The servants were often woken in the middle of the night.

analysis: 文中提到：“But with the rooster dead, the woman did not know what time it was, and often woke the servants even in the middle of the night.”公鸡死了之后，女主人不知道确切时间，经常在半夜就把仆人叫醒干活，因此选C。

question.cn: 在第二十四天的故事The Scorpion and the Frog中，为什么蝎子会咬死青蛙？
question.en: In the story the Scorpion and the Frog during Day 24, why did the scorpion kill the frog?

options.cn: 因为这是他的本性，他无法控制自己。
options.en: Because It was his nature, he couldn't help it.
Because the frog attacked him first.

analysis: 文中提到：“The scorpion replied, ‘I can't help it, it's in my nature.’”可知，蝎子的本性使他咬了青蛙，因此选B。

question.cn: 在第二十五天的故事The Sick Stag中，什么造成了雄鹿的死亡？
question.en: In the story the Sick Stag during day 25, what caused the death of the stag?

analysis: 文中提到：“ Finally he died, not from his sickness, but from a lack of food.” 可知最后鹿被饿死了，因此选C。

question.cn: 在第二十七天的故事The Town Mouse and the Country Mouse中，乡村老鼠的食物是什么？
question.en: In the story the Town Mouse and the Country Mouse during day 27, what was the country mouse's meal?

analysis: 文中农村的老鼠邀请城镇的老鼠去他家作客的时候提到：“The simple meal of corn and roots was not to the taste of the guest.”由此可知答案选A。

question.cn: 在第二十七天的故事The Travelers and the tree中，树有什么作用？
question.en: In the story the Travelers and the Tree during day 27, what was the use of the tree?

options.en: To shelter the travelers from the sun.

analysis: 文中提到：“You ungrateful men! You say I’m useless while resting under me to hide from the sun!”可见，树木可以帮助游人遮挡阳光，因此选C。

question.cn: 在第二十九天的故事the Wolf in Sheep’s Clothing中，牧羊人为什么会杀掉伪装的狼？
question.en: In the story the Wolf in Sheep’s Clothing during day 29, why did the shepherd kill the disguised wolf?

options.cn: 牧羊人把狼当成羊杀掉了。
options.en: The shepherd thought the wolf was a sheep.

options.cn: 牧羊人很生气狼欺骗了他。
options.en: The shepherd was angry that the wolf fooled him.

analysis: 文中提到：“But that night the shepherd, wanting some meat for his dinner, caught the wolf thinking he was a sheep, and killed him with his knife on the spot.”牧羊人晚上想吃一些肉，就把狼当成羊杀了，因此选A。

share_title: 100天读完3本英文书，今天是第30天
